intro: Sesseopsis, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its smooth, often milky sap. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Sesseopsis species are often found in dry or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their deep root systems. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
